intro: Bulbinopsis bulbosa, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous form. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is a popular choice among gardeners in Mediterranean climates.
